Articles.Content: So I have seen in some Youtube videos that people are able to build craft which are attached via shielded docking ports. (ie a lander inside of a cargo bay) but in my game when I try to attach another docking port to a shielded or inline port (ie Mk2) i have no attachment nodes. What gives? am I missing something or is there a Mod which adds this feature? thanks for any help.

If you see someone using a docking port to attach a lander inside of a cargo bay, then they're not using shielded docking ports; they're using a regular docking port that just happens to be inside the cargo bay.

The shielded docking ports (inline clamp-o-tron, Mk2 clamp-o-tron, shielded docking ports) are generally for putting on the outside of a craft, and their purpose is to have something that's aerodynamic for atmospheric flight but can be opened for docking when in space.
Has anyone done testing of the drag for the shielded port in comparison to nose cones?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64711-1-0-TweakableEverything-1-12-For-all-your-part-tweaking-needs

I believe Tweakable Everything is what you are looking for...
